TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Sandy, mixed Typic Cryorthents

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Fossil sand on a pitted outwash plain, on a slope of 1 percent at an elevation of 4 m (When described on June 09, 2013, the soil was moist throughout.)
Oe--0 to 10 cm; moderately decomposed plant material; moderately acid (pH 5.9); clear smooth boundary
A--10 to 27 cm; gravelly coarse sand, light yellowish brown (2.5Y 6/3) dry, olive brown (2.5Y 4/3) moist; single grain; loose, nonsticky and nonplastic; common fine and medium roots throughout; common very fine and fine interstitial pores; 5 percent cobbles and 15 percent gravel; very slightly effervescent (HCL, 1N); slightly alkaline (pH 7.5); clear smooth boundary
C1--27 to 50 cm; variegated very gravelly coarse sand; single grain; loose, nonsticky and nonplastic; common very fine and fine interstitial pores; 10 percent cobbles and 40 percent gravel; strongly effervescent (HCL, 1N); strongly alkaline (pH 8.5); clear smooth boundary
C2--50 to 95 cm; variegated coarse sand; massive; loose, nonsticky and nonplastic; few very fine interstitial pores; 10 percent medium gravel; strongly effervescent (HCL, 1N); moderately alkaline (pH 7.9), clear smooth boundary
C3--95 to 150 cm; variegated extremely gravelly coarse sand; single grain; loose, nonsticky and nonplastic; few very fine interstitial pores; 5 percent cobbles and 70 percent medium gravel; strongly effervescent (HCL, 1N); strongly alkaline (pH 8.5)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve-Gustavus Area, Alaska; Hoonah-Angoon Census Area; latitude 58.4674386, longitude -135.9816388 datum WGS84 (coordinates determined by a GPS unit)

*Clay content--0 to 1 percent
*Total rock fragment content--35 to 85 percent

Thickness--5 to 13 cm

Fine-earth texture--coarse sand, sand, fine sand
Clay content--0 to 1 percent
Total rock fragment content--15 to 35 percent
Gravel content--10 to 20 percent
Cobble content--5 to 10 percent
Reaction (pH)--6.8 to 7.7
Thickness--10 to 20 cm
C1 horizon
Hue--10YR to 2.5Y moist or dry, variegated

Fine-earth texture--coarse sand, sand, fine sand
Clay content--0 to 1 percent
Total rock fragment content--35 to 65 percent
Gravel content--30 to 50 percent
Cobble content--5 to 15 percent
Reaction (pH)--7.3 to 8.7
Thickness--15 to 50 cm
C2 horizon

Value--4 or 5 moist, 6 or 7 dry
Chroma--3 to 6 moist or dry
Fine-earth texture--coarse sand, sand, fine sand
Clay content--0 to 1 percent
Total rock fragment content--5 to 12 percent
Gravel content--5 to 12 percent
Cobble content--0 to 3 percent
Reaction (pH)--7.1 to 8.2
Thickness--30 to 55 cm
C3 horizon

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Elevation--8 to 70 m
Climate--cool, moist summers; mild, wet winters
Mean annual precipitation--800 to 1850 mm
Mean annual air temperature--1 to 9 degrees C
Frost-free period--90 to 154 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
Fingers--25 to 50 cm (somewhat poorly drained) to saturation and aquic conditions; in drainageways of similar landforms
Tyeen--loamy-skeletal particle-size class; free carbonates throughout particle-size control section; on adjacent landforms
Vivid--saturation and aquic conditions within 25 cm of soil surface; on adjacent landforms

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
Drainage class--well drained
Depth to saturation in normal years--more than 150 cm year round
Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--very high throughout

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Use--wildlife habitat, recreation
Potential natural vegetation--oval-leaf blueberry, heartleaf twayblade, Alaska huckleberry, five-leaf bramble, rattlesnake plantain, Sitka alder, goose neck moss, sidebells wintergreen

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Alexander Archipelago-Gulf of Alaska Coast, Alaska; MLRA 220; moderate extent

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Portland, Oregon

ORIGIN.content: SERIES PROPOSED: Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve-Gustavus Area, Alaska; 2020; name from Fossil Peak in Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and other features in this pedon
*Ochric epipedon
*Free carbonates--zone from 10 to 150 cm
*Particle-size control section--zone from 35 to 110 cm
